answers.answer: I'm at 25 weeks... My left foot has been the only area I've had swelling so far! And it is only sometimes! I was worried when it first happened because I read that swelling on one side only could

Sorry!....could mean a blood clot. So I talked to my ob and here's what she said:Call the doc if the swelling is red, painful, and/or warm.It is normal to have a little more swelling on one side because of the pressure of the baby on different areas of the vasculature that carries the blood to our limbs.Hope that helps :)

Thank you :-) its not red or warm so I guess I'll just keep my feet up and see if it goes down. I've had the blood work for preeclampsia done and it came back negative so I know it's not that. Plus I'm due in 7 days and have an appointment on Tuesday anyway so if it doesn't go down by then maybe I can get him to induce me lol
It should be fine,  with my first I didn't get swelling until the end and with in a week after delivery it went down alot.  Your almost there, hang in there

question: Does anyone else swell more on one side than the other? I'm 39 weeks and have pretty bad swelling. It effects both feet but my right definitely swells more than the left one.... Just curious if this happens to anyone else...
title: swelling
